instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: imac 820-2901-A not communicating with video card
threads.message: Chime when power on. The diagnostic leds only show 1 and 2, Led 3 is missing. The video card is tested good on another machine.

threads.title: imac 820-2901-A not communicating with video card
threads.message:
Can you specify which LEDs in page 5?
Did you heat the GPU for test?

threads.title: imac 820-2901-A not communicating with video card
threads.message:
The GPU is fine as it is a separate MXM card and I tested the card in a separate machine to ensure it is good. 

I was refering to the diagnostic LED, as described on page 29 of the service manual: [URL]https://elektrotanya.com/apple_imac_27-inch_mid2010.pdf/download.html[/URL]

I followed the procedure and bump onto page 47 where it said replace logic board so I figured it is the board that need to be fixed.

threads.title: imac 820-2901-A not communicating with video card
threads.message:
I ONLY look on the schematic when try to help.
You should be able to locate on the same schematic the LEDs which stay on; boardview can help you at this moment.

If the MXM card is good, probably you have some failure on the power on sequence.
So tell us which voltages appear on your board.
Which is stable and which pulses only, if is the case.

threads.title: imac 820-2901-A not communicating with video card
threads.message: diagnostic LED 3 is LED604 on page 6 of the schematic.

threads.title: imac 820-2901-A not communicating with video card
threads.message:
First check J8400 power rails, at page 73.
If any missing w/o LCD, check again after connect it.
